    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractBuilder

        public AbstractBuilder(OutputStream out)
        Create a new Builder that will use the given OutputStream to write out the fasta records.
        Parameters:
        out - the OutputStream to use; can not be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if out is null.

      • AbstractBuilder

        public AbstractBuilder(File outputFile)
                throws IOException
        Create a new Builder that will use the given File to write out the fasta records. Any contents that previously existed in this file will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        outputFile - the File to use; can not be null. Since 5.3, if the file extension is either ".gz" or ".zip" then the writer will automatically compress the output for you.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if outputFile is null.
        IOException - if the file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, does not exist but cannot be created, or cannot be opened for any other reason.

        Get the number of symbols that should be printed on each line of the fasta record body.
        Returns:

      • charset

        public final B charset(Charset charset)
        Change the Charset used to write out the fasta record. If this method is not called, then the CharSet will default to UTF-8.
        Parameters:
        charset - the Charset to use; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if charset is null.

      • lineSeparator

        public final B lineSeparator(String eol)
        Change the end of line separator String.
        Note: This method should be used with caution. Many fasta parsers will only expect lines to be terminated with '\n'.
        Parameters:
        eol - the end of line string to use to denote end of lines; can not be empty. If set to null, then the default '\n' is used.
        Returns:
        this.

      • numberPerLine

        public final B numberPerLine(int numberPerLine)
        Change the number of bases per line to write for each fasta record. If this method is not called, then the a default value will be used. If allBasesOnOneLine() is also called, then whichever method is called last "wins".
        Parameters:
        numberPerLine - the basesPerLine to use must be >=1.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if basesPerLine <1.
        See Also:
        allBasesOnOneLine()

      • allBasesOnOneLine

        public final B allBasesOnOneLine()
        Write all the bases on one line instead of allowing the possibility of multiple lines. If numberPerLine(int) is also called, then whichever method is called last "wins".
        Returns:
        this.
        See Also:
        numberPerLine(int)

      • create

        protected abstract W create(OutputStream out,
                            int numberOfResiduesPerLine,
                            Charset charSet,
                            String eol)
        Create a new instance of a FastaWriter with the given non-null parameters.
        Parameters:
        out - the OutputStream that the new writer will use to output the fasta data; will never be null.
        numberOfResiduesPerLine - the number of residues per line that should be written to the file. If a sequence length is more than this number, then the sequence should be split over several lines, each line never exceeding this value.
        charSet - the Charset to encode the output to, usually UTF-8.
        Returns:
        a new FastaWriter; can not be null.

      • sortInMemoryOnly

        public B sortInMemoryOnly(Comparator<F> comparator)
        Write out the FastaRecords written by this writer sorted by the specified Comparator but do all the sorting in memory. All of the records will be cached in memory so the output can be written sorted when the Closeable.close() method is called. It is not recommended to use this method if a large number of records will be written because an OutOfMemoryError may occur.
        Parameters:
        comparator - the Comparator to use to sort the FastaRecords; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if comparator is null.
        Since:
        5.0

      • sort

        public B sort(Comparator<F> comparator)
        Write out the FastaRecords written by this writer sorted by the specified Comparator using a combination of in memory sorting and writing out sorted temporary files using the default in memory cache size (currently 1024 records).

        This is the same as sort(comparator, 1024 which uses the default temp area to make temp files.

        Parameters:
        comparator - the Comparator to use to sort the FastaRecords; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if comparator is null.
        Since:
        5.3

      • sort

        public B sort(Comparator<F> comparator,
              int inMemoryCacheSize)
        Write out the FastaRecords written by this writer sorted by the specified Comparator using a combination of in memory sorting and writing out sorted temporary files.

        This is the same as sort(comparator, inMemCacheSize, null) which uses the default temp area to make temp files.

        Parameters:
        comparator - the Comparator to use to sort the FastaRecords; can not be null.
        inMemoryCacheSize - the in memory cache size to use; must be positive.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if comparator is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if inMemoryCacheSize < 1.
        Since:
        5.0

      • sort

        public B sort(Comparator<F> comparator,
              int inMemoryCacheSize,
              File dir)
        Write out the FastaRecords written by this writer sorted by the specified Comparator using a combination of in memory sorting and writing out sorted temporary files. An in memory cache similar of the specified size will be created and whenever the cache fills, the sorted cache contents will be written to a temp file in the specified tmpDir and the cache cleared out to make room for more records to write. There may be multiple temp files written depending on how many FastaRecords are passed to the Writer. Once Closeable.close() has been called, the contents of the in memory cache, and any temp files written out are merged and written sorted to the final output file.

        If any files get written to temp files under dir, they will be deleted when the writer is closed. However dir itself will not be deleted so feel free to provide non-temp directories as well.

        Parameters:
        comparator - the Comparator to use to sort the FastaRecords; can not be null.
        inMemoryCacheSize - the in memory cache size to use; must be positive.
        dir - the directory to write files to; if set to null then the default system temporary directory is used. If the value is not null, then it must be a directory that already exists.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if comparator is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if inMemoryCacheSize < 1, or if a non-null dir does not exist or is not a directory.
        Since:
        5.0
